text.div:
Id: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.Yellowfever
Url: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Version: 0.2.0
Title: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Status: draft
Date: 2025-07-17 20:56:25+0000
Publisher: WHO
Description:

Determine required vaccinations
Knowledge Capability: computable
Related Artifacts:

References

  • WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)
Libraries:
DTs.Yellowfever
Actions:
Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination: Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" The vaccine is contraindicated in children aged under 6 months and is not recommended for those aged 6–8 months, except during epidemics when the risk of infection with the yellow fever virus is very high.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as client's age is less than 9 months. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination: Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" As a general rule, any live vaccine may be given either simultaneously or at an interval of 4 weeks.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is due for yellow fever vaccination: Client is due for yellow fever vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" In endemic countries, it is recommended that yellow fever vaccine be given to children aged 9–12 months at the same time as the measles vaccine. Preventive mass vaccination campaigns are recommended for inhabitants of areas at risk of yellow fever where there is low vaccination coverage. Vaccination should be provided to everyone aged 9 months and older in any area with reported cases. Vaccination should also be offered if the individual is travelling to and from at-risk areas, if not contraindicated. As a general rule, any live vaccine may be given either simultaneously or at an interval of 4 weeks. Oral poliovirus vaccine may be given at any time in relation to yellow fever vaccination.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for yellow fever vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as no yellow fever dose was administered, client is within appropriate age range and no live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete: Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete "Immunization recommendation status" = "Complete" "Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "Yellow fever vaccines") –
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete. One yellow fever primary series dose was administered. Check for any other vaccines due.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

relatedArtifact.citation: WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

action.title: Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

The vaccine is contraindicated in children aged under 6 months and is not recommended for those aged 6–8 months, except during epidemics when the risk of infection with the yellow fever virus is very high.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression: Should not vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as client's age is less than 9 months. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next dose.

action.title: Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for yellow fever vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

As a general rule, any live vaccine may be given either simultaneously or at an interval of 4 weeks.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. 
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first dose.

action.title: Client is due for yellow fever vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for yellow fever vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

In endemic countries, it is recommended that yellow fever vaccine be given to children aged 9–12 months at the same time as the measles vaccine. Preventive mass vaccination campaigns are recommended for inhabitants of areas at risk of yellow fever where there is low vaccination coverage.

Vaccination should be provided to everyone aged 9 months and older in any area with reported cases.

Vaccination should also be offered if the individual is travelling to and from at-risk areas, if not contraindicated.

As a general rule, any live vaccine may be given either simultaneously or at an interval of 4 weeks. Oral poliovirus vaccine may be given at any time in relation to yellow fever vaccination.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with yellow fever dose as no yellow fever dose was administered, client is within appropriate age range and no live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. 
Check for contraindications.

action.title: Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete
action.description:
Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Complete"
"Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "Yellow fever vaccines")

–

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Yellow fever immunization schedule is complete. One yellow fever primary series dose was administered. 
Check for any other vaccines due.
